constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA Name: Park Road Conservation Area
LOCCEN Name: Kingston Hill and Park Road

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT
VALUER Type: VALUERSDescription: Highways and Transport

application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details required for Conditions 3 (External Materials), 4, 13, 22 (Construction Management Plan), 5 (Boundary Treatment), 7 (Obscure Privacy Screens), 9 (Climate Change Mitigation), 10 (Secure Cycle Parking), 11 (Refuse and Recycling), 14 (Noise Levels), 15 (Environmental Noise Assessment), 16 (Sound Transmission Reduction Measures), 17 (Plant Noise Level Rating), 19 (Acoustic Insulation) and 20 (Management of Land Contamination) of planning permission 22/00864/FUL (Demolition of the existing building and erection of a three-storey building to provide nine residential units (Use Class C3) and 315 sqm of commercial (Class E) floorspace with associated refuse/recycling facilities and cycle storage)
decision_conditions: The applicant has submitted insufficient information to satisfy the requirements of Condition 3 (External Materials). Therefore fails to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant has submitted insufficient information to satisfy the requirements of Conditions 4, 13 & 22 (Construction Management Plan). Therefore fails to safeguard the amenities and living conditions of the surrounding residential occupiers and safeguard highway safety and the free flow of traffic in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant has submitted insufficient information to satisfy the requirements of Condition 19 (Acoustic Insulation). Therefore, failing to ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy D14 of the London Plan 2021 policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
